alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 24 at 3:51PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...Widespread light snow Thursday evening through early Friday afternoon... Light snow is expected to develop across Cook Inlet by Thursday evening as a storm system moves into Southcentral from the west. Southwesterly flow ahead of this system will push the band of light snow north and east across the Anchorage Bowl and into the Mat-Su Valleys tonight. The snow is expected to taper off through Friday morning across the Anchorage Bowl and Susitna Valley as the wind flow shifts to the west and drier air moves in. With the developing westerly flow, snow may linger across the Anchorage Hillside north along the Glenn Highway to Eagle River and Palmer into Friday afternoon before tapering off. 1 to 2 inches of snow is expected across the Anchorage Bowl, with the potential for additional inch or so across the Anchorage Hillside to Eagle River. 2 to 4 inches of snow is expected across the Mat-Su Valleys. An inch or less of snow is expected across the western Kenai Peninsula. There is still some uncertainty with regard to the exact track of this storm system. As such, storm total snow amounts continue to be a challenge. Be prepared for winter weather conditions and challenging driving conditions. For updates, please visit www.weather.gov/afc.

area.areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula
